info.name: Test Dynamic Temperature + Answer Quality
info.description: Test collection for Dynamic Temperature and Answer Quality Detection features

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Java Developer",
  "level": "Junior",
  "skills": ["Spring Boot", "REST API"],
  "cv_text": "Fresh graduate with 1 year internship experience in Spring Boot",
  "jd_text": "Looking for junior Java developer to build REST APIs",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 48
}

request.description:
Test initial question for Junior level.
Expected: temperature_actual ‚âà 0.5 (0.6 base - 0.1 initial)

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Senior Java Architect",
  "level": "Senior",
  "skills": ["Microservices", "System Design", "AWS"],
  "cv_text": "10 years experience in enterprise Java development",
  "jd_text": "Need senior architect to lead microservices transformation",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 48
}

request.description:
Test initial question for Senior level.
Expected: temperature_actual ‚âà 0.65 (0.75 base - 0.1 initial)

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Java Developer",
  "level": "Mid-level",
  "skills": ["Spring Boot", "PostgreSQL"],
  "previous_question": "Tell me about your Spring Boot experience",
  "previous_answer": "I used Spring Boot for 2 years",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 48
}

request.description:
Test with VERY SHORT answer (7 words).
Expected:
- detail_level: minimal
- quality_score: < 0.3
- strategy: encourage_detail
- temperature_actual: ‚âà 0.6 (reduced for probing)

Should ask to elaborate more

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Backend Developer",
  "level": "Mid-level",
  "skills": ["Redis", "Caching"],
  "previous_question": "How do you handle caching in your applications?",
  "previous_answer": "Caching is very important for performance. I know about Redis and Memcached. They help reduce database load and improve response time. Proper cache invalidation is crucial.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 48
}

request.description:
Test with answer that has NO concrete examples (45 words).
Expected:
- detail_level: brief
- has_examples: false
- technologies: [redis, memcached]
- strategy: request_example

Should ask for specific example

body.raw:
{
  "role": "DevOps Engineer",
  "level": "Mid-level",
  "skills": ["Docker", "Kubernetes", "CI/CD"],
  "previous_question": "Describe your containerization experience",
  "previous_answer": "I have extensive experience with Docker and Kubernetes. In my last project, we containerized a monolithic application into microservices using Docker. Then deployed them on Kubernetes cluster with auto-scaling. We used Helm charts for deployment management and implemented CI/CD pipeline with Jenkins.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 48
}

request.description:
Test with answer mentioning multiple technologies (70+ words).
Expected:
- detail_level: moderate/detailed
- technologies: [docker, kubernetes, jenkins]
- quality_score: 0.7-0.8
- strategy: probe_technology

Should dig deeper into mentioned tech

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Software Engineer",
  "level": "Senior",
  "skills": ["System Design", "Scalability"],
  "previous_question": "How would you design a notification system?",
  "previous_answer": "For a notification system, I would use a queue-based architecture with Kafka. We need to handle push notifications, emails, and SMS. First, events are published to Kafka topics. Then consumer services pick up these events and send notifications through respective channels. For reliability, I would implement retry logic with exponential backoff. We also need dead letter queues for failed messages. The system should support rate limiting to avoid overwhelming users and respect quiet hours preferences.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 48
}

request.description:
Test with GOOD comprehensive answer (100+ words with examples).
Expected:
- detail_level: detailed
- has_examples: true
- technologies: [kafka]
- quality_score: 0.75-0.85
- strategy: explore_edge_case

Should ask about edge cases/failures

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Tech Lead",
  "level": "Senior",
  "skills": ["Architecture", "Leadership"],
  "previous_question": "Tell me about your experience leading technical teams",
  "previous_answer": "I have been leading technical teams for the past 5 years. In my current role, I manage a team of 12 engineers working on microservices architecture. My responsibilities include technical planning, code reviews, mentoring junior developers, and architectural decisions. We use agile methodologies with 2-week sprints. I implemented several improvements: established coding standards using SonarQube, introduced automated testing practices increasing coverage from 40% to 85%, migrated legacy monolith to microservices reducing deployment time from 2 hours to 15 minutes. I also conduct regular 1-on-1s with team members focusing on career development. For technical challenges, I promote collaborative problem-solving through design review sessions. We use Confluence for documentation and JIRA for project tracking. I believe in servant leadership and creating psychological safety for the team to innovate and learn from failures. Recently led migration to Kubernetes which improved our resource utilization by 40%.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 48
}

request.description:
Test with EXTENSIVE detailed answer (200+ words).
Expected:
- detail_level: extensive
- quality_score: > 0.85
- strategy: change_topic
- temperature_actual: ‚âà 0.8 (increased for variety)

Should transition to different topic

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Full Stack Developer",
  "level": "Mid-level",
  "skills": ["React", "Node.js", "PostgreSQL"],
  "previous_question": "How do you handle state management in React?",
  "previous_answer": "I use Redux for complex applications and Context API for simpler cases. Redux provides better debugging with DevTools.",
  "conversation_history": [
    {"question": "Tell me about yourself", "answer": "I'm a full stack developer with 4 years experience"},
    {"question": "What's your experience with React?", "answer": "I've been using React for 3 years"},
    {"question": "Tell me about a complex React project", "answer": "I built an e-commerce platform with real-time updates"},
    {"question": "How did you handle real-time updates?", "answer": "Used WebSockets with Socket.io"},
    {"question": "What about scalability?", "answer": "Implemented Redis caching and load balancing"},
    {"question": "How do you optimize React performance?", "answer": "Use React.memo, useMemo, lazy loading"},
    {"question": "Tell me about your backend experience", "answer": "Built REST APIs with Node.js and Express"},
    {"question": "How do you handle authentication?", "answer": "JWT tokens with refresh token rotation"},
    {"question": "Database design approach?", "answer": "Normalized design with proper indexing"},
    {"question": "How do you ensure data consistency?", "answer": "Use database transactions and proper constraints"}
  ],
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 48
}

request.description:
Test with 10+ conversation history.
Expected:
- temperature_actual: ‚âà 0.8 (0.7 base + 0.1 for deep conversation)
- More creative/diverse question
- May change topic or explore from different angle

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Backend Developer",
  "level": "Senior",
  "skills": ["Microservices", "AWS"],
  "previous_question": "How do you handle service-to-service communication?",
  "previous_answer": "I use both synchronous REST APIs and asynchronous message queues with RabbitMQ depending on the use case. For critical real-time operations I prefer REST, for background jobs I use queues.",
  "conversation_history": [
    {"question": "Q1", "answer": "A1"},
    {"question": "Q2", "answer": "A2"},
    {"question": "Q3", "answer": "A3"},
    {"question": "Q4", "answer": "A4"},
    {"question": "Q5", "answer": "A5"},
    {"question": "Q6", "answer": "A6"},
    {"question": "Q7 - Should appear in prompt", "answer": "A7 - Should appear"},
    {"question": "Q8 - Should appear in prompt", "answer": "A8 - Should appear"},
    {"question": "Q9 - Should appear in prompt", "answer": "A9 - Should appear"},
    {"question": "Q10 - Should appear in prompt", "answer": "A10 - Should appear"},
    {"question": "Q11 - Should appear in prompt", "answer": "A11 - Should appear"}
  ],
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 48
}

request.description:
Test that only last 5 Q&A pairs are used in prompt.
Check logs to verify Q7-Q11 appear, Q1-Q6 don't.
Should see 'Recent Conversation (last 5 Q&A)' in logs

item.name: 11. CV/JD Extraction - With Full CV and JD

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Java Developer",
  "level": "Junior",
  "skills": ["Spring Boot", "REST API"],
  "cv_text": "John Doe - Software Engineer. Fresh graduate with 1.5 years of internship experience in Spring Boot and REST API development. Built REST APIs for e-commerce platform using Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, and Redis. Developed user authentication service handling 10,000+ requests per day. Implemented caching strategy that reduced database load by 40%. Tech Stack: Java, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker, Git.",
  "jd_text": "Junior Java Developer - We are looking for a Junior Java Developer with 1-2 years experience. REQUIREMENTS (Must Have): Java and Spring Boot, REST API design, PostgreSQL or MySQL, Git version control, OOP principles and design patterns. NICE TO HAVE: Redis caching, Kafka or RabbitMQ, Docker and Kubernetes, AWS cloud services (EC2, S3), CI/CD with Jenkins.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 128
}

request.description:
Test CV/JD Extraction feature.
Expected:
- CV: Extract 1.5 years, techs (Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker), achievement (40% reduction)
- JD: Extract must-have (Java, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, Design Patterns) vs nice-to-have (Kafka, Kubernetes, AWS)
- Skill Gap: Missing Design Patterns (must-have), Kafka/AWS (nice-to-have)
- Question should FOCUS on missing skills: Design Patterns, Kafka, or AWS

Check logs for: 'CV Extraction:', 'JD Extraction:', 'Skill gap analysis:'

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Backend Developer",
  "level": "Mid-level",
  "skills": ["Microservices", "Docker", "Kubernetes"],
  "cv_text": "Senior Backend Developer with 4 years experience. Expert in Spring Boot microservices, Docker containerization. Built and deployed 15+ microservices. Strong in PostgreSQL, Redis, REST APIs. No experience with Kafka or Kubernetes yet.",
  "jd_text": "Mid-level Backend Developer needed. MUST HAVE: 3-5 years experience, Microservices architecture, Docker, Kafka message queues, Kubernetes orchestration. NICE TO HAVE: AWS, Terraform, Prometheus monitoring.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 128
}

request.description:
Test Skill Gap Detection - Critical Missing Skills.
Expected:
- CV: 4 years, has Spring Boot, Docker, PostgreSQL, Redis
- JD: Must-have Kafka and Kubernetes (MISSING!)
- Skill Gap: CRITICAL gaps - Kafka, Kubernetes
- Focus: üéØ kafka, kubernetes

Question should ask about Kafka or Kubernetes experience/learning, NOT about skills they already have.
Check logs for 'CRITICAL GAPS' and 'focus areas'

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Senior Java Architect",
  "level": "Senior",
  "skills": ["Microservices", "System Design", "AWS"],
  "cv_text": "Senior Software Architect with 8+ years experience. Expert in Java, Spring Boot, microservices architecture. Designed and built cloud-native applications on AWS using EC2, S3, Lambda, EKS. Strong experience with Kafka, RabbitMQ, Redis, PostgreSQL. Led migration from monolith to microservices for 3 companies. Proficient in Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD.",
  "jd_text": "Senior Java Architect - 7+ years experience required. Must have: Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, AWS cloud, Kafka or RabbitMQ, Docker and Kubernetes. Nice to have: System design experience, Team leadership, Terraform.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 128
}

request.description:
Test with NO skill gaps - candidate has ALL required skills.
Expected:
- CV: 8+ years, ALL must-have techs present
- JD: Must-have all covered
- Skill Gap: missing_must_have = [] (empty!)
- Focus: Should focus on DEPTH and leadership/architecture questions

Question should be challenging architectural/design question, NOT basic skill probing.
Should explore edge cases, scalability, trade-offs.

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Java Developer",
  "level": "Junior",
  "skills": ["Spring Boot", "REST API"],
  "cv_text": "John Doe - Junior Developer with 1.5 years experience. Built REST APIs using Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, and Redis. Developed user authentication service handling 10,000+ requests per day. Implemented caching that reduced database load by 40%. Tech Stack: Java, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker, Git.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 128
}

request.description:
Test CV-ONLY extraction (no JD).
Expected:
- CV: Extract 1.5 years, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker
- NO JD extraction
- NO skill gap analysis
- Question should EXPLORE DEPTH of CV skills (Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, Redis)
- Ask about practical experience, challenges, achievements

Check logs for: 'CV-BASED INTERVIEW', 'explore their DEPTH'

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Backend Developer",
  "level": "Mid-level",
  "skills": ["Microservices", "Kafka", "Docker"],
  "jd_text": "Mid-level Backend Developer - 3-5 years experience. MUST HAVE: Java Spring Boot, Microservices architecture, Kafka message queues, Docker containerization, PostgreSQL database, REST API design. NICE TO HAVE: Kubernetes, AWS, Redis caching, CI/CD experience.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 128
}

request.description:
Test JD-ONLY extraction (no CV).
Expected:
- NO CV extraction
- JD: Extract must-have (Spring Boot, Microservices, Kafka, Docker, PostgreSQL, REST)
- NO skill gap (kh√¥ng c√≥ CV ƒë·ªÉ compare)
- Question should ASSESS REQUIRED SKILLS from JD
- Practical scenario-based questions about must-have skills

Check logs for: 'JD-BASED INTERVIEW', 'assessing these REQUIRED skills'

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Java Developer",
  "level": "Junior",
  "skills": ["Spring Boot", "REST API"],
  "cv_text": "John Doe - Software Engineer. Fresh graduate with 1.5 years of internship experience in Spring Boot and REST API development. Built REST APIs for e-commerce platform using Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, and Redis. Developed user authentication service handling 10,000+ requests per day. Implemented caching strategy that reduced database load by 40%. Tech Stack: Java, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker, Git.",
  "jd_text": "Junior Java Developer - We are looking for a Junior Java Developer with 1-2 years experience. REQUIREMENTS (Must Have): Java and Spring Boot, REST API design, PostgreSQL or MySQL, Git version control, OOP principles and design patterns. NICE TO HAVE: Redis caching, Kafka or RabbitMQ, Docker and Kubernetes, AWS cloud services (EC2, S3), CI/CD with Jenkins.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 128
}

request.description:
Test CV/JD Extraction with SKILL GAPS.
Expected:
- CV: Extract 1.5 years, techs (Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker)
- JD: Must-have (Java, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, Design Patterns) vs Nice-to-have (Kafka, Kubernetes, AWS)
- Skill Gap: MISSING Design Patterns (must-have!), Kafka/AWS (nice-to-have)
- Focus: üéØ design patterns, kafka, aws
- Question should PROBE missing skills, especially Design Patterns

Check logs for: 'SKILL GAP FOCUS', 'missing X critical skills'

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Backend Developer",
  "level": "Mid-level",
  "skills": ["Microservices", "Docker", "Kubernetes"],
  "cv_text": "Senior Backend Developer with 4 years experience. Expert in Spring Boot microservices, Docker containerization. Built and deployed 15+ microservices. Strong in PostgreSQL, Redis, REST APIs. No experience with Kafka or Kubernetes yet.",
  "jd_text": "Mid-level Backend Developer needed. MUST HAVE: 3-5 years experience, Microservices architecture, Docker, Kafka message queues, Kubernetes orchestration. NICE TO HAVE: AWS, Terraform, Prometheus monitoring.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 128
}

request.description:
Test CRITICAL skill gaps detection.
Expected:
- CV: 4 years, has Spring Boot, Docker, PostgreSQL, Redis
- JD: Must-have Kafka and Kubernetes (BOTH MISSING!)
- Skill Gap: ‚ùóCRITICAL missing_must_have = [kafka, kubernetes]
- Focus: Kafka or Kubernetes
- Question should ask about Kafka/K8s experience or willingness to learn

Check logs for: 'CRITICAL: kafka, kubernetes', 'missing 2 critical skills'

body.raw:
{
  "role": "Senior Java Architect",
  "level": "Senior",
  "skills": ["Microservices", "System Design", "AWS"],
  "cv_text": "Senior Software Architect with 8+ years experience. Expert in Java, Spring Boot, microservices architecture. Designed and built cloud-native applications on AWS using EC2, S3, Lambda, EKS. Strong experience with Kafka, RabbitMQ, Redis, PostgreSQL. Led migration from monolith to microservices for 3 companies. Proficient in Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD.",
  "jd_text": "Senior Java Architect - 7+ years experience required. Must have: Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, AWS cloud, Kafka or RabbitMQ, Docker and Kubernetes. Nice to have: System design experience, Team leadership, Terraform.",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_tokens": 128
}

request.description:
Test with NO skill gaps - perfect candidate match.
Expected:
- CV: 8+ years, ALL must-have techs present
- JD: All must-have covered, has nice-to-have too
- Skill Gap: missing_must_have = [] (EMPTY!)
- NO critical gaps message
- Question should be CHALLENGING: architecture, scalability, trade-offs, leadership
- Focus on DEPTH, not basic probing

Check logs: Should NOT see 'CRITICAL GAPS' or 'missing skills'
